definitions.definition: To stretch out, open out (a material etc.) so that it more fully covers a given area of space.
definitions.example: He spread his newspaper on the table.

definitions.definition: To extend (individual rays, limbs etc.); to stretch out in varying or opposing directions.
definitions.example: I spread my arms wide and welcomed him home.

definitions.definition: To disperse, to scatter or distribute over a given area.
definitions.example: I spread the rice grains evenly over the floor.

definitions.definition: To proliferate; to become more widely present, to be disseminated.
To disseminate; to cause to proliferate, to make (something) widely known or present.
definitions.example: The missionaries quickly spread their new message across the country.

definitions.definition: To take up a larger area or space; to expand, be extended.
definitions.example: I dropped my glass; the water spread quickly over the tiled floor.

definitions.definition: To smear, to distribute in a thin layer.
definitions.example: She liked to spread butter on her toast while it was still hot.

definitions.definition: To cover (something) with a thin layer of some substance, as of butter.
definitions.example: He always spreads his toast with peanut butter and strawberry jam.

definitions.definition: To prepare; to set and furnish with provisions.
To open one’s legs, especially for sexual favours.
The act by which something is spread.
